subject: Re: [junit] How to print string messages using JUNIT even if the test method is passing

messageBody:
Anshumaan Rajshiva wrote:

> I want to know a way by which i can dump useful information in a test
> case using JUNIT even if it is passing. Till now, all the assert
> statements throws message only if the statement fails. I want to know
> is there a way to dump a message even if the assert statement passes??

You could just print to the console, or adding logging to your test cases.

One of the design philosophies behind JUnit is that, if all the tests
pass, we only care about seeing an "OK" or a green bar. We only want
information if tests fail. That is why, "out of the box", JUnit does not
provide information about passing tests.

Take care.
